title: Creates the crime of display of sexual material in a vehicle
summary: Creates the crime of display of sexual material in a vehicle while on display in a public place.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1560

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 10, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. ORTIZ -- read once and referred to the Committee
         on Codes

       AN ACT to amend the penal law, in relation to the crime  of  display  of
         sexual material in a vehicle

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The penal law is amended by adding a new section 245.12  to
    2  read as follows:
    3  S 245.12 DISPLAY OF SEXUAL MATERIAL IN A VEHICLE.
    4    1.  A PERSON IS GUILTY OF DISPLAY OF SEXUAL MATERIAL IN A VEHICLE WHEN
    5  HE OR SHE IS IN A VEHICLE THAT IS LOCATED IN A PUBLIC PLACE AND A  SEXU-
    6  ALLY  EXPLICIT  VIDEO IS BEING DISPLAYED ON A VIDEO OR TELEVISION SCREEN
    7  LOCATED WITHIN THAT VEHICLE THAT IS CAPABLE OF BEING SEEN  BY  A  PERSON
    8  WHO IS NOT LOCATED WITHIN THE VEHICLE.
    9    2.  THE  CRIME  OF  DISPLAY  OF  SEXUAL MATERIAL IN A VEHICLE SHALL BE
   10  PUNISHABLE BY UP TO TWO THOUSAND HOURS OF COMMUNITY SERVICE.
   11    3. ANY PERSON CONVICTED OF THE CRIME OF DISPLAY OF SEXUAL MATERIAL  IN
   12  A  VEHICLE  SHALL,  IN  ADDITION TO ANY COMMUNITY SERVICE REQUIRED TO BE
   13  PERFORMED, HAVE ONE POINT ADDED TO HIS OR HER DRIVING RECORD.
   14    DISPLAY OF SEXUAL MATERIAL IN A VEHICLE IS A VIOLATION.
   15    S 2. The commissioner of motor vehicles is authorized and directed  to
   16  implement  and/or  amend any rule or regulation necessary for the timely
   17  implementation of this act on its effective date.
   18    S 3. This act shall take effect on the one hundred twentieth day after
   19  it shall have become a law.



        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD04021-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the penal law, in relation to the crime of display of sexual material in a vehicle
